newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Sembawang disappoints with 42 pct H1 profit fall.
newsitem.headline: Sembawang disappoints with 42 pct H1 profit fall.

text.p: Diversified marine conglomerate Sembawang Corp on Friday announced a 42.2 percent fall in first-half net profit to Singapore $17.12 million from S$29.62 million a year ago.

Group revenue rose 21.9 percent to S$728.18 million in the six months to June 30, 1996, from S$597.19 million in the same period in 1995. But the group's operating profit fell 18.3 percent to S$51.66 million, from S$63.22 million.
Sembawang said in a statement it had faced difficult market conditions in the shiprepair business, and this had affected the performance of its marine and heavy industries group.
The company's transportation and logistics sectors also suffered from a lack of salvage operations, it said.
Dealers said the result was well below market expectations.
"Our analyst's last forecast, which was recently revised downwards, was a net profit of S$20.8 million, or a fall of 32 percent from last year," said one dealer. "This really is disappointing."
Sembawang posted an extraordinary gain of S$51.49 million, which it said was due to "gains realised from disposal of quoted investments held for long-term purposes".
The group statement gave no immediate hope for a dramatic improvement in its situation.
"Difficult operating conditions are expected to prevail in the second half of 1996, but barring unforeseen circumstances, the directors expect a satisfactory performance," it said.
